title: Domain 3.1: Given a scenario, troubleshoot common Windows OS problems.
content:
⚠️ Common Windows Symptoms

  • 💥 Blue screen of death (BSOD): A critical system crash, often due to hardware failure, driver issues, or corrupted system files.
  • 🐌 Sluggish performance: Caused by low RAM, full storage, malware, or background CPU usage.
  • 🔁 Boot problems: Failure to load Windows; possible causes include bootloader corruption or failing drives.
  • 🔌 Frequent shutdowns: Can be due to overheating, bad PSU, or faulty RAM.
  • 🚫 Services not starting: Background services may fail due to misconfigurations or missing dependencies.
  • 💥 Applications crashing: Often caused by compatibility problems, low resources, or corrupt files.
  • 📉 Low memory warnings: Occurs when RAM is exhausted—Windows prompts user action.
  • 🧩 USB controller resource warnings: Happens when USB devices draw too much power or conflict.
  • 🔄 System instability: Random freezes or crashes can indicate hardware or driver problems.
  • 🔍 No OS found: BIOS/UEFI can't detect an OS—often from drive issues or boot order settings.
  • 🕰️ Slow profile load: User login takes long; may be due to corrupted profiles or slow network logins.
  • ⏱️ Time drift: System clock going out of sync—commonly a CMOS battery or NTP issue.

🧰 Common Troubleshooting Steps

  • 🔁 Reboot: A simple restart can fix many temporary issues.
  • 🔄 Restart services: Fix services like Windows Update or Print Spooler when stuck.
  • 📦 Uninstall/reinstall/update applications: Helps fix crashing or broken apps.
  • 💾 Add resources: Install more RAM or free up storage to improve performance.
  • 📋 Verify requirements: Confirm system meets software or OS install specs.
  • 🧪 System file check: Run sfc /scannow to scan/repair system files.
  • 🧱 Repair Windows: Use Startup Repair or DISM for deeper OS repair.
  • ♻️ Restore: Roll back to a working restore point using System Restore.
  • 📀 Reimage: Use system image recovery to restore Windows in enterprise setups.
  • ⏪ Roll back updates: Uninstall recent Windows updates if problems began after one.
  • 👤 Rebuild Windows profiles: Fix user profile issues by creating a new profile.
